definitions.definition: A proposal that has been made.
examples: I decline your offer to contract.

definitions.definition: Something put forth , bid , proffered or tendered .

( law ) An invitation to enter into a binding contract communicated to another party which contains terms sufficiently definite to create an enforceable contract if the other party accepts the invitation.
examples: His first letter was not a real offer , but an attempt to determine interest.

main_definition: A proposal that has been made.
secondary_definitions: Something put forth , bid , proffered or tendered .

( law ) An invitation to enter into a binding contract communicated to another party which contains terms sufficiently definite to create an enforceable contract if the other party accepts the invitation.

labels: used in combinations from phrasal verbs

main_definition: ( used in combinations from phrasal verbs ) agent noun of off
